data.title: Implement Direct Font Importer and Processor
data.body:
Stuff done:
- Implements direct importer / processor for font files (.ttf, .otf)
- Implements CharacterRegionsDescription object and it's TypeConverter so we can serialize/deserialize it
- Implements Char and CharacterRegionsDescription cell editors for Pipeline Tool
- A minor fix with sending object type in propertygrid

Notes:
- I left style in, even tho it doesn't do anything without #4561

Screenshots:
![screenshots](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6773302/16707359/71ec0a36-45ca-11e6-94d9-ec0e3d7ecc11.png)

data.title: Fixes #4977
data.body: Modified msbuild targets file, so that when mgcb's are built, their build output is copied to a directory in the output folder that is relative to the path of the mgcb within the project. This allows the content that is output (.xnb's) to more easily be isolated, by moving mgcb's to seperate folders within the project.

data.title: Refactored texture processing for platform extensibility

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
This is a follow up to https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/4992.

Here I've added a new `TextureProfile` and `DefaultTextureProfile` classes which do the work previously scattered across `GraphicsUtil`, `TextureProcessor`, and the font processors.

Like with the work on shader processing...  one just need to implement a new instance of `TextureProfile` to add support for compressing textures to a new format for a new platform.

Our existing texture processing unit tests should prove this change consistent with the previous system.

data.title: IsButtonDown(Buttons.RightTrigger) always returning false on Cross Platform project
data.body:
As the title states, when I attempt to use the isButtonDown method of a GamePadState to check if Buttons.RightTrigger or Buttons.LeftTrigger are down it always returns false. The trigger values report accurate amounts however.

This occurs in the Cross Platform Project specifically, and does not appear to happen in any of the windows projects.

data.title: Model exported from Blender as .dae with UV texture as .png fails on iOS build in pipeline
data.body:
The MonoGame tutorial at http://www.gamefromscratch.com/post/2015/08/20/Monogame-Tutorial-Beginning-3D-Programming.aspx shows importing a Blender exported model with texture into a MonoGame project. As instructed, the project and model work fine on for a MacOS project. When using the same model (same code too) for an iOS version, the build fails of the project fails. The structure I am using is a shared project that has the common game code and game assets (the model) in the .mgcb file. There are two other projects in the solution, one for the MacOS version and the other for an iOS version that both reference the shared project and hence include the shared .mgcb. I am using XS 5.10.3 with MonoGame 3.5.1. When building from the Pipeline GUI, there is no error. When building from XS, the build fails saying the MGCB.exe command exited with code:1. Copying that command and running it in Terminal while in the Content directory of the shared project, yields the following error:

```
/usr/local/bin/mono "/Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/External/xbuild/MonoGame/v3.0/Tools/MGCB.exe" /@:"/Users/ksuda/Documents/My Xarmarin Projects/TestMono/TestMonoCommon/Content/CommonContent.mgcb" /platform:iOS /outputDir:"/Users/ksuda/Documents/My Xarmarin Projects/TestMono/TestMonoIOS/Content/bin/iOS" /intermediateDir:"/Users/ksuda/Documents/My Xarmarin Projects/TestMono/TestMonoIOS/Content/obj/iOS" /quiet
Skipping /Users/ksuda/Documents/My Xarmarin Projects/TestMono/TestMonoCommon/Content/fpsFont.spritefont
/Users/ksuda/Documents/My Xarmarin Projects/TestMono/TestMonoCommon/Content/MonoCube.dae
    /Users/ksuda/Documents/My Xarmarin Projects/TestMono/TestMonoCommon/Content/MonoCubeTexture.png
        Could not convert texture. System.PlatformNotSupportedException: iOS platform only supports PVR texture compression
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.GraphicsUtil.GetTextureFormatForPlatform (TextureProcessorOutputFormat format, TargetPlatform platform) <0x3f4ab90 + 0x0009f> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.GraphicsUtil.CompressTexture (GraphicsProfile profile, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.TextureContent content, TextureProcessorOutputFormat format, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context, Boolean generateMipmaps, Boolean sharpAlpha) <0x3f4aa18 + 0x00027> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.TextureProcessor.Process (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.TextureContent input, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context) <0x3f45698 + 0x00743> in <filename unknown>:0 
/Users/ksuda/Documents/My Xarmarin Projects/TestMono/TestMonoCommon/Content/MonoCube.dae: error: Processor 'TextureProcessor' had unexpected failure!
System.PlatformNotSupportedException: iOS platform only supports PVR texture compression
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.TextureProcessor.Process (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.TextureContent input, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context) <0x3f45698 + 0x00973> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessor`2[TInput,TOutput].Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.IContentProcessor.Process (System.Object input, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context) <0x3f3db10 + 0x00087> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineManager.ProcessContent (MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineBuildEvent pipelineEvent) <0x2fc6740 + 0x002ed> in <filename unknown>:0 
```

The content folder has both the MonoCube.dae and MonoCubeTexture.png files in it, but I only added the .dae to the .mgcb. If you add the .png as the tutorial describes, you get an additional message embedded before the above exception:
`Warning: Asset MonoCubeTexture.png built multiple times with different settings.`
I realize that .png files are not supported on iOS, but I would think that if I had a shared model that included a texture, that the texture would be converted automatically as appropriate. If I change the .mgcb to only include the texture, it does convert file but the model is not there of course. I would expect whatever settings the .png gets converted to for building on iOS, should also apply to .png (or any texture) when building a model that includes the texture. I further tried a .fbx with the texture embedded, but got different problem (separate issue).

Attached is the MonoCube.zip from the tutorial. I repeated the same steps for creating and exporting the model from Blender as described in a related tutorial to the one above (newer version of Blender than used in tutorial) and get the same error.

[MonoCube.zip](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/files/352610/MonoCube.zip)

data.title: Fix issues with modifying presentation parameters with multisampling enabled
data.body:
When you enable multisampling at game startup, it determines the maximum multisampling count allowed by the hardware and configured both the swap chain and depth stencil view with it.

However, when you `ApplyChanges` at runtime, it had a hard-coded value of 4 if multisampling was enabled.  Due to this, if you modified the presentation parameters (in my specific case it was enabling window resizing), it would cause the multisampling count of the swap chain (now 4) and the multisampling count of the depth stencil view (still 16 in my case) to get out of sync, which is not permitted in DirectX.  The end result of this was that instead of rendering working correctly, the window would be entirely black, with nothing rendered.

This moved the maximum multisampling count logic into a platform-specific method on the `GraphicsDevice`, and ensures that method is called whenever the multisampling count needs to be adjusted by MonoGame.

It also addresses a scenario where a `RenderTarget` could be created with a different multisampling count on the depth stencil view than the underlying texture resource.  This update texture to keep track of the sample description used when creating the resource, and forces the logic to use the same parameters when creating the depth stencil view, to avoid the same scenario occurring on render targets as was occurring on the swap chain.

data.title: Refactor ShaderProfile to allow for pipeline extensibility

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
This PR is the first baby step towards making the content pipeline more easily extendable for new platforms.

Here I refactored the existing `enum ShaderProfile` into a class that knows how to perform various platform specific steps of the effect compiling process.

This also introduces a helper class `LoadedTypeCollection<T>` which scans loaded assemblies for types of a particular base class.  We use this to gather the different instances of `ShaderProfile` which in the future could live in different pipeline extension assemblies.

This same technique will be applied to audio and texture processing next.

data.title: More Pipeline issues
data.body:
A few issues with the new Eto Pipeline tool:
- Canceling a build fails on first try...  second try it crashes.
- Right clicking on a folder and hitting `Rebuild` in the treeview does not rebuild all the items in that folder.
- Right clicking an item in the treeview does not select it before showing the context menu.
- Treeview selection seems really slow at times on a project with lots of content items.
- You can trigger content building from tree view context menu while a build is already in progress.
- Shift and Ctrl multiselection does not work in treeview.
- The current cancel build icon looks the same enabled as disabled... needs color to it.

I'd like to see these issues which all worked correctly before Eto addressed before we add any more new features.

data.title: Is it possible to somehow implement mouse lock?
data.body:
I've tried to search through forums and found no solution to lock mouse cursor to the game's window.

It would be awesome to have it. Something like "Mouse.IsLocked=true".

Why is it needed? When playing on multi-monitor systems clicking near the border of the game window (even in full screen) becomes a HUGE pain.

Real life example. This issue happened in Dota 2 some time ago:
I play, I try to nuke someone near the border of the screen, I click outside of the game window, the window minimizes itself, gg, wp.

Also if someone has some ideas how to implement it, I would be glad to hear them.
The variant with
...
if(mouseState.X<0) Mouse.SetPosition(0, mouseState.Y);
...
does not work, because with high-dpi mouse I manage to go half a monitor to the left and click a few times before this code executes.

P.s. Sorry if the "issues" section is the wrong place to post about it.

data.title: [Content Pipeline Tool] Link to folder issue intended ?
data.body:
I've linked a folder within the solution it references to _"../../GameAssets"_ from the content.mgcb when run. It will not output as _"Content/bin/****/GameAssets"_ it will output as _"Content/GameAssets"_. Im guessing it has to do with the files being references by _"../../"_. Is this intended or is it me that's using it wrong.

Files were referenced/added through the Content Pipeline Tool.

Edit: Quick mention when building for release it goes into the correct build path.

data.title: Fixes the recent addition of OpenGL version initialization.
data.body: The existing logic didn't take into account the difference in version string on OpenGL ES, causing it to always default to version 1.1 .  This adds logic specific to OpenGL ES that properly gets the version number.

data.title: Problem with Multiple Mgcb's
data.body:
Hello,
I am attempting to split out some content so I can use 2 seperate `ContentManager` instances.

I assumed if I referenced two seperate `mgcb` files from my project, that I could get them to output their content to different directories when I build my project.

When creating a `ContentManager` you need to give it a root directory, so I assumed I could create one for each content directory where my `mgcb` content is output:

```
 var contentOne = new ContentManager(this.Services, "Content\\ScreenManagement");
 var contentTwo = new ContentManager(this.Services, "Content\\Models");
```

The problem is, when I build the project, the assets from the multilple referenced `mgcb`s are always output directly to the `content` folder under py projects output directory. Furthermore, the 1st output is cleared when the 2nd `mgcb` is built, and so I actually only end up with the content of the 2nd `mgcb` file in by output directory.

Here is how it looks (note I added the `mgcb` files using `Add as Link`

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3176632/16542754/c116b93e-40ad-11e6-8a28-0a143b1e4e03.png)

It doesn't seem to matter which folder in my project that I add the reference to the `mgcb` too, when I build they always seem to output to the outputDir/Content folder for my project.

This means I don't end up with seperate root paths to create my ContentManager instances for, and also the build clearing the content output by the first mgcb when it builds the second one is obvioulsy a bit problematic!

Any ideas?

data.title: Pipeline: renaming effect => invalid leading '\' added in Content.mgcb
data.body:
Having an effect file.fx, rename it, with pipeline tool (build from today MG source update):

file.fx become => **\**file.fx as the example below

```
#begin \PPDepthNormalMod.fx
/importer:EffectImporter
/processor:EffectProcessor
/processorParam:DebugMode=Auto
/build:\PPDepthNormalMod.fx
```

(effect PPDepthNormal.fx renamed to PPDepthNormalMod.fx from pipeline itself)

Then, there is an error when building project using this content (kind of "filepath format no handled", damned MS with their translate-everything-madness) from both pipeline itself and VS.

Win7 64b, VS 2015 Com. Ed., MG dev windows(DX) platform, x86 arch, tools and libs build for anycpu arch.

data.title: netstandard
data.body: With the introduction of `netstandard` can we expect a move away from the PCL approach, to instead adopt this new paradigm?

data.title: Added support for XACT reverb and filter effects

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
Further work on XACT support to make more correct to XNA. The major changes in this one:
- Support for reading reverb info and applying the effect.
- Support for reading low/band/high pass filters and applying the effect.
- Fix cases where track variations were not being set correct.

Note that the reverb and filter effects only work on XAudio2/Windows platforms... we still need implementations of them for OpenAL and other audio backends.

As part of some of the changes some tabs to spaces were changed, so use this link to see the actual differences:

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/4974/files?w=0
